actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on March 8, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick moved that the House do now adjourn
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 393
actions-list.actionItem: 22 (Roll no. 133).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1123 — "To direct the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information to submit to Congress a report examining the cybersecurity of mobile service networks, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under Clause 5(d) of Rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the administration of the Oath of Office to the Gentlewoman from Virginia, Mrs. McClellan, the whole number of the House is 435.

Representative-Elect, Jennifer L. McClellan, Fourth District, Commonwealth of Virginia, presented herself in the well of the House for the purpose of taking the Oath of Office which was administered by the Speaker of the House.

The House received a message from the Clerk. The Clerk transmitted to the House a facsimile copy of a letter received from Ms. Susan J. Beals, Commissioner, Commonwealth of Virginia Department of Elections, indicating that, according to the unofficial results for the Special Election held February 21, 2023, the Honorable Jennifer McClellan was elected for Represenative to Congress for the Fourth Congressional District, Commonwealth of Virginia.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 422
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 132).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1226 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to allow for the electronic request of certain records, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 1226, as amended, H.R. 1123, as amended, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 7.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1123.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1123 — "To direct the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information to submit to Congress a report examining the cybersecurity of mobile service networks, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1226.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1226 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to allow for the electronic request of certain records, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 815.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 815 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to make certain improvements relating to the eligibility of veterans to receive reimbursement for emergency treatment furnished through the Veterans Community Care program, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 753.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 753 — "To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to use on-site regulated medical waste treatment systems at certain Department of Veterans Affairs facilities, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 502.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 502 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to ensure that the Secretary of Veterans Affairs repays members of the Armed Forces for certain contributions made by such members towards Post-9/11 Educational Assistance, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 7.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

The House received a communication from Jacob Wolak, Field Representative/Caseworker, Representative Sanchez. Pursuant to Rule VIII of the Rules of the House of Representatives, Mr. Wolak notified the House he had been served with a subpoena for testimony issued by the Superior Court of Los Angeles County, State of California and that after consultation with the Office of General Counsel, he had determined that compliance with the subpoena is consistent with the privileges and rights of the House.
Pursuant to Section 4(c) of House Resolution 5, 118th Congress, the Democratic Leader appointed the following member of the House to the Tom Lantos Human Rights Commission: Mr. McGovern.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 194 — "Electing Members to the Joint Committee of Congress on the Library and the Joint Committee on Printing."
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 645.
The Chair designated Ms. Garcia of TX to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 7.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 p.m. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Ben Cline to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
